channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024030119
item.description:
Report X-2024030119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND METAL CONTAINING ON THE FLOOR OF TRAINER LEAKING AND ANOTHER PACKAGE NEXT TO IT LEAKED UPON. RESPONDER THEN PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP SPILL, PLACE DAMAGED CONTAINER INTO SPILL TRAY. RESPONDER LOADED SPILL TRAY AND OTHER DAMAGED PACKAGE ONTO SPILL CART TO RETURN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024030231
item.description:
Report E-2024030231

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XEN experienced a UN1139 Bright Kure & Seal release from (2) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 8-gallons of product released to an 8â€™ x 15' area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were then collected into a second 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030160
item.description:
Report E-2024030160

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: FARMINGTON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (!) 5-gallon pail of acetone was damaged in transit and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, pavement beneath the trailer, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EX Environmental (EXE) to remediate the impacted site. EXE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal.
